alert.note: Alert for Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:53AM MDT until April 16 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... Little Minnesota River near Peever affecting Roberts County. Minnesota River near Big Stone Lake affecting Roberts, Grant and Big Stone Counties. Minnesota River at Ortonville affecting Big Stone County. North Fork Whetstone River near Milbank affecting Grant County. 12 Mile Creek near Wheaton affecting Traverse County. West Branch 12 Mile Creek At Dumont affecting Traverse County. 5 Mile Creek Near Herman affecting Traverse County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Little Minnesota River near Peever. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Left bank below gage begins flooding. This is the new gage site approx 1 mile north of old site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Saturday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 13.9 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 400 PM CDT.
